definition: to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
to search/to look for/to seek
quarrel/dispute/a blood sacrifice (arch.)
disorderly behavior (PRC law)

sentences.english: Avoid loud and aggressive persons, they are vexatious to the spirit.
sentences.chinese: 避开喧闹寻衅者，他们会扰人心神。

sentences.english: John picked a fight with Jack and came off worst.
sentences.chinese: 约翰寻衅和杰克打架，结果大吃苦头。

sentences.english: During these states, sufferers will sometimes pick fights at random and then hide underground.
sentences.chinese: 在这状态下，患者会时不时的寻衅，然后躲起来。

sentences.english: Some people get aggressive after drinking spirits.
sentences.chinese: 有些人酒后爱寻衅惹事。

sentences.english: Would wainwright find some way to retaliate within the bank ?
sentences.chinese: 温赖特会不会在银行内部寻衅报复呢？

sentences.english: Jim often gets into fights because he goes about with a chip on his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆经常同人打架，因为他整天都是一副寻衅的样子。

sentences.english: The children bantered him for a fight.
The man became belligerent when he drank too much beer.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人喝多了啤酒之后就变得爱寻衅滋事。

sentences.english: Blade wheel was belligerent passengers by the Japanese patrolled boat hit.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋所乘客轮被寻衅的日军巡查艇击中。

to carry out a vendetta against sb
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to send punitive forces against/(fig.) to criticize violently
to incite/to stir up/to instigate
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to look for trouble
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to rely on power
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
